results.title: Now 'airport'
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of Kennedy Airport which is a hub of perpetual motion and a gateway to America. Every day and night jet planes from all over the world land and depart from this busy international airport - here on film is captured its color, movement and noise.

results.title: November = Novembre
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Robert Nichol
results.brief_description: A hundred and one lingering, luminous impressions of the month when the ripe fullness of the Canadian autumn wilts and the whole earth seems to settle into brooding calm. This is a cine-poem, reflecting the somber moods of November, the still, waiting separateness when the Canadian year dawdles, hangs back from the hour when the first snowfall will make all things even. But from the muted tones of the dying season emerges a new, stark beauty. Film without words. (Contains images of duck hunting and animial skinning that may offend some viewers.)

results.title: Nova: the search for life
results.brief_description: Explains DNA and how it works. Shows an experiment by Professor Stanley Miller in which he produced amino acids, and an experiment by researchers at the University of Miami who created small moving one-celled creatures by putting drops of amino acids on hot lava and washing them off with rainwater. Narrated by Hal Douglas.

results.title: Nous Ne Vieillirons Pas Ensemble = We will not grow old together
results.brief_description:
This powerful romantic drama examines the final period of a long and ultimately unhappy affair. For six years, Jean has had an affair with the much younger Catherine, in full knowledge of his wife, Francoise. Jean is a domineering man and his relationship with Catherine is made up of constant quarreling and reconciliation. During a filming trip in the Camargue, they have one more row and Catherine realises something in the relationship is definitely broken. She attempts to keep her distance from Jean and starts referring to their affair in the past tense. Pialat’s potent, bleak realism combines a demanding, quasi cinema-verite approach with the reworking of personal issues such as marital breakdown. Script and direction probe and reveal the intricacies of the dying days of a long love affair, lent extra conviction by the uncompromising performances of forceful Jean Yanne and wistful Jobert. Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1972 - Best Actor: Jean Yanne.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Pierre Rassam ; director, Maurice Pialat ; writer, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Luciano Tovoli ; music, Joseph Haydn.
Cast: Jean Yanne, Marlene Jobert, Macha Meril, Patricia Pierangeli, Christine Fabrega, Jacques Galland, Maurice Risch, Harry Max, Muse Dalbray.

results.title: Nous N'irons Plus Au Bois = We Will Not Enter the Forest
results.creator_credit: Catherine Winter, Gisele Rebillon and Georges Dumoulin
results.brief_description:
During Summer 1944, a group of young people takes to the woods with orders to keep guard on four German deserters. However, Lise, a liaison agent starts a romance with Werner, one of the prisonners.

Credits: Producers, Gisele Rebillon, Catherine Winter ; director, Georges Dumoulin ; writer, Catherine Varlin ; photography, Alain Derobe ; music, Michel Sendrez.
Cast: Marie-France Pisier, Siegfried Rauch, Richard Leduc, Jacques Higelin, Jacques Masson, Siegfried Rauch, Sylvain Joubert, Georges Rouquier.

results.title: Nous les Jericho = Sacre Grand-Pere = Dear Old Grandpa
results.brief_description:
Jericho is a retired veterinarian who lives on a property in Provence. He invites his grandson and his wife to spend the holidays. Although Marie and Jacques are about to divorce, they agree to disguise it in order to spare Jericho’s feelings. Jericho knows better, and realising that the couple is estranged, slyly works to bring about a reconciliation.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Laurent ; director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writers, Jacques Poitrenaud, Albert Cossery, Maria Suire ; photography, Jean-Marc Ripert ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Michel Simon, Marie Dubois, Thalie Fruges, Serge Gainsbourg, Jeanne Helia, Yves Lefebvre, Mary Marquet.

results.title: Nous les Gosses = Us Kids
results.brief_description:
A group of schoolchildren decide to work during their holidays in order to pay for a large glass window they have broken while playing soccer in the schoolyard. But their treasure is under threat. Filmed during the Occupation, this ‘poetic realist’ film extolls the virtues of solidarity and mateship inherited from the Popular Front era.

Credits: Producer, Jean Faurez ; director, Louis Daquin ; writers, Gaston Modot, Maurice Hilero, Marcel Ayme ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Marius-Francois Gaillard ; art direction, Lucien Aguettand ; editor, Suzanne de Troeyes.
Cast: Louise Carletti, Gilbert Gil, Pierre Larquey, Louis Seigner, Andre Brunot, Raymond Bussieres, Emile Genevois, Paul Frankeur.

results.title: Notting Hill
results.creator_credit: Duncan Kenworthy, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment and Roger Mitchell
results.brief_description: Hugh Grant plays William Thacker, owner of a travel bookstore in London’s Notting Hill. A chance visit to his store by famous American movie star, Anna Scott, played by Julia Roberts, sparks a complicated romance between the two. The worlds of celebrity and everyday people in collision creates a series of misunderstandings and dilemmas which divide and reunite the pair on more than one occasion. In an adventurous finale William rallies his ensemble of old friends and a mad flatmate to try one last time to get the girl. A British romantic comedy from the makers of “Four Weddings and a Funeral”. Cast also includes Hugh Bonneville, Emma Chambers and James Dreyfus.

results.title: Notornis Expedition
results.brief_description: The New Zealand native flightless bird, the Notornis, or Takahe, thought for 80 years to be extinct, is photographed in its natural surroundings in a practically inaccessible high mountain valley.
